title: Conceptual Mapping-Based Learning Design for Distance Education and Social Problem Solving

context.prior_knowledge: Basic language proficiency and general understanding of social issues
context.additional_context: Students perform in-class collaborative activities using personal devices and gain project-based learning experiences to solve social issues

learning_goals: Learners can perform document analysis by applying conceptual mapping techniques for solving social issues in remote education settings
Learners understand UNESCO's social development concepts and can propose practical implementation plans linked to educational design (ADOIVA Framework)
Learners design real-world social problem solutions through large-scale team projects and present results using verbal/non-verbal communication skills
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
